options.content:
# Objective
The goal of this dashboard is to provide visibility
 on the level of traffic flowing through the 
 environment and make sure that Cloud Pak for
  AIOps is properly configured to handle it
  as described in the [sizing documentation](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/4.6.1?topic=planning-hardware-requirements#aimgr_custom).

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of events ingested into the system over 3m averages. 

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.lifecycle.input.events
panels.title: Event ingestion rate

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of alert create/update requests over 3m averages. 

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.irdatalayer.changes.alerts
panels.title: Alert request rate

panels.description: Count that tracks alert create/update requests in time range. Updates can come from events, manual user changes, and Cloud Pak for AIOps enrichments.
panels.title: Alerts created/updated in time range

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of incident create/update requests over 3m averages. 

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.irdatalayer.changes.stories
panels.title: Incident request rates

panels.description: Count that tracks incident create/update requests in time range. Updates can come from alerts, manual user changes, and IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps enrichments.
panels.title: Incidents created/updated in time range

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of logs ingested into the system over 1m averages. Log integrations can be created in the Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge-logs-.*-raw

defaults.noValue: No logs ingested in time range

panels.title: Log rate

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of metrics ingested into the system over 3m averages. Metric integrations can be created in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.analyticsorchestrator.metrics.itsm.aggregated

defaults.noValue: No metrics ingested in time range

panels.title: Metrics rate

panels.description:
Count of metrics ingested within the time range. Metric integrations can be created in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

To view an accurate count, select a time window that is equal to, or longer than the metric aggregation interval . For example, if the aggregation interval is 5 minutes, select a time window from the time picker that is at least 5 minutes long. The aggregation interval is viewable and configurable in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.analyticsorchestrator.metrics.itsm.aggregated
panels.title: Metrics ingested in time range

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of runbooks executed in the system over 1m averages. Runbooks can be created and configured under the Cloud Pak for AIOps Automations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.lifecycle.output.rba-exec-requests

defaults.noValue: No runbooks executed in time range

panels.title: Runbook execution rate

panels.description:
Time series that tracks the ServiceNow request rates per minute for:
* incidents create/updates
* alerts updates
* change risk assessments

This does not include requests made for polling. Those requests are made at consistent, configurable intervals that can be set in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps ServiceNow integration.
panels.title: Request rates

panels.description: Count that tracks incident create/update requests sent to ServiceNow within the time range. Subtract (Incident create/update failures) from this number to calculate the number of successful requests.
panels.title: ServiceNow Incident create/update requests

panels.description:
Count that tracks incident create/update requests sent to ServiceNow that resulted in an error within the time range. 

Failures could be due to lack of permissions, check that the integration user has the appropriate roles: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/latest?topic=integrations-servicenow-app-integration#create_roles
panels.title: ServiceNow incident create/update errors

panels.description:
Time series that tracks the request rates per minute for:
* Issue creation requests/success/failure
* Issue update requests/success/failure
* Poll requests/success/failure
panels.title: Request rates

panels.description: Count that tracks the number of Github issues created successfully within the time range.
panels.title: Create successes

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of Github issues that could not be created due to errors within the time range.

Please review that the Github credentials and instance details are valid. For more information on configuring the Github integration see: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/latest?topic=integrations-github
panels.title: Create failures

panels.description: Count that tracks the number of Github issues updated successfully within the time range.
panels.title: Update successes

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of Github issues that could not be updated due to errors within the time range.

It is expected for this number to be greater than 0 when an incident is initially created. Incident creation is usually immediately followed by a few updates. The Github integration cannot process these updates until after the Github issue has been created, thus the updates will fail. Subsequent updates should succeed as normal.

For failures that occur after initial incident creation, please review that the Github credentials and instance details are valid. For more information on configuring the Github integration see: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/latest?topic=integrations-github
panels.title: Update failures

panels.description:
Time series that tracks the request rates per minute for:
* Issue creation requests/success/failure
* Issue update requests/success/failure
* Poll requests/success/failure
panels.title: Request rates

panels.description: Count that tracks the number of Jira issues created successfully within the time range.
panels.title: Create successes

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of Jira issues that could not be created due to errors within the time range.

Please review that the Jira credentials and instance details are valid. For more information on configuring the Jira integration see: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/latest?topic=integrations-jira
panels.title: Create failures

panels.description: Count that tracks the number of Jira issues created successfully within the time range.
panels.title: Update successes

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of Jira issues that could not be updated due to errors within the time range.

It is expected for this number to be around 1/3 the value of the updates successes. When an incident is initially created, it is immediately followed by a few updates. The Jira integration cannot process these updates until after the Jira issue has been created, thus the updates will fail. Subsequent updates should succeed as normal.

For failures that occur after initial incident creation, please review that the Jira credentials and instance details are valid. For more information on configuring the Jira integration see: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/latest?topic=integrations-jira
panels.title: Update failures

panels.description:
Time series that tracks the ChatOps request rates for:
* Notification requests received (by internal ChatOps component)
* notifications sent successfully
* notification failures
panels.title: Request rates

panels.description: Count that tracks the number of notification successfully sent to the external Chat Platform (Slack/Teams) within the time range.
panels.title: Notifications sent

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of notifications that could not be sent to the external Chat Platform (Slack/Teams) due to errors within the time range.

Please review that the ChatOps credentials and channel ids are valid. For more information on configuring the ChatOps integrations, see:
* MS Teams: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/latest?topic=integrations-microsoft-teams-integration
* Slack: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/latest?topic=integrations-slack-integration
panels.title: Notification failures

panels.description:
A histogram showing incident counts along with the amount of time elapsed between incident creation and Slack notification.

Histogram displaying the ChatOps notification times. This shows the time elapsed from incident creation to ChatOps notification. 

This gives insight into the speed at which users are being notified of incidents via ChatOps.

Values on the bottom are ranges of time in seconds. Values on the bottom are the number of notifications that were sent in that time range.
panels.title: Notification times

title: IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps - Usage
